name: Fractured Speedsters Trivia Game | Fractured Mixed Entertainment | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
Lightning McQueen.

	Voiced by Owen Wilson, the character first appeared in Disney's "Cars" (2006). Several shorts, a spin-off, a TV series and sequels all were made after the original.

Wally West.

	Wally West was the first Kid Flash and the third Flash in DC Comics. He also appeared in the 2015 live-action television series played by Keiynan Lonsdale. In that show he was portrayed as Kid Flash.

Barry Allen.

	Barry was the second DC Comics character to be known as The Flash, his first comic appearance was in "Showcase" #4 in 1956. The character has been in several animated TV shows, live-action series, movies, video games and other mass media.

Clark Kent.

	Clark Kent, or Superman, is one of the fastest beings on Earth, though he's not from Earth. The character first appeared in 1939's "Action Comics" #1. Superman has been in comics, radio, movies, television and just about every other form of mass media over the years.

Jesse Quick.

	Jesse Quick is another DC Comics speedster who has also appeared on "The Flash" (2015) TV series. On that series she was played by Violett Beane. She has also been known as Liberty Bell in the comics.

questions.text: Pie Ate Roe Ma Axe Em Off
questions.explanation:
Pietro Maximoff.

	Also known as Quicksilver, his first appearance was in one of "X-Men" #4. The character was created by Stan Lee and Jack Kirby in 1964. In recent years he has appeared in movies released as part of both the official "Marvel Comics Universe" and the "X-Men" series of films.

Billy Batson.

	Billy Batson, who was also known as Captain Marvel and later Shazam, is a child who transforms into one of the most most powerful characters in the DC Comics universe. His powers are magic based, but they rival the levels of Superman himself. As Captain Marvel, the characters first appearance was in "Whiz Comics" #2, which at the time was owned by Fawcett Comics. Fawcett was bought out and later became part of the DC universe.

Makkari.

	Makkari is one of the Eternals in the Marvel Comics universe. The character's first appearance was in "Red Raven Comics" #1, at that time he was known as Mercury. He was also known as Hurricane for a time in the 1940s. He was revealed to be one of the Eternals when the characters got their own series in 1976. He was created by Jack Kirby.

Daphne Millbrook.

	Played by Brea Grant, the character debuted in one of the tie-in "Heroes" graphic novels before being ported over the the "Heroes: Reborn" TV series. The character was a reformed thief who married Matt Parkman within the universe of the show/novels.

Dash Parr.

	Dash is the son in a family of superheroes in the Disney animated movie "The Incredibles".  The character was created by writer/directer Brad Bird. He was performed by Spencer Fox in the first movie and by Raymond Ochoa in several video games.
